statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: ShawnDre' Jones scored 35 points and Marshall Wood had 29, both career highs, and Richmond raced to a 93-82 win over Fordham on Sunday.
article.headline: Jones, Marshall lead Richmond to 93-82 win over Fordham
article.linkText: Jones, Marshall lead Richmond to 93-82 win over Fordham
article.story: NEW YORK -- ShawnDre' Jones scored 35 points and Marshall Wood had 29, both career highs, and Richmond raced to a 93-82 win over Fordham on Sunday. Terry Allen added 17 points and T.J. Cline 12 for the Spiders (9-6, 1-2 Atlantic 10), who only had four players score. Trey Davis had 11 assists and four steals. Mandell Thomas had 22 points and Ryan Rhoomes 18 for the Rams (10-4, 1-2), who had a 10-game home streak snapped. They shot 60 percent but Richmond shot 54.5 percent (30 of 55), made 13 of 28 3-pointers and finished 20 of 23 from the foul line after missing its only attempt in the first half. Fordham was up 13 early but Wood hit 6 of 18 3s and had 22 points, four more than his career best, to put the Spiders up 47-39 at the break. The Rams were within four with 1:56 left when Wood hit his only 3 of the second half.
